channel.title: INSPIRE Lab @ UCF on INSPIRE Lab @ UCF
channel.description: Recent content in INSPIRE Lab @ UCF on INSPIRE Lab @ UCF

item.title: NSF Workshop: Cyber-enabled to Support Carbon-Neutral Electricity and Mobility
item.description: Dr. Guo will serve as the panelist on the NSF-sponsored workshop: Cyber-enabled to Support Carbon-Neutral Electricity and Mobility at TAMU from Apr. 24-25, 2023. The title of his talk is on Opportunities and Challenges for Large-scale Transportation Electrification.

item.title: System-level impacts of en-route information sharing considering adaptive routing
Co-optimization of Charging Scheduling and Platooning for Long-haul Electric Freight Vehicles
Electric Vehicles for Distribution System Load Pickup Under Stressed Conditions: A Network Equilibrium Approach
Spatial Pricing of Ride-sourcing Services in a Congested Transportation Network
Best student paper award (Energy Systems Track, 3rd place) in IISE Annual Conference
item.description: INSPIRE LAB’s paper on Multi-stage Charging Station and Distributed Generator Planning in Decentralized Power Distribution and Transportation Systems received the 3rd place in the best student paper award competition in Energy System Track in IISE Annual Conference 2022. Congratulations Sina and Rakibul!

item.title: Presentations at IISE 2021
item.description: We will have three presentations at IISE Annual Conference 2022 at Seattle from May 21 to May 24, 2022. Sina will present the work, coauthored with Rakibul Alam and Dr. Guo, on multi-stage multi-agent charging infrastructure and distributed generators planning in coupled transportation and power systems. Dr. Guo will present two of the works on the charging infrastructure planning for ride-sourcing systems (coauthored with Rakibul) and network modeling with en-route information updates for transportation systems (coauthored with Fatima).

item.title: Optimization-based trip chain emulation for electrified ride-sourcing charging demand analyses
Charging Infrastructure Planning for Ride-sourcing Electric Vehicles Considering Driversâ€™ Value of Time
Presentation at 2022 7th Annual UTC Conference for the Southeastern Region
item.description: Rakibul presented one of his recent research at 2022 7th Annual UTC Conference for the Southeastern Region. The title of the presentation is Co-optimization of Charging Scheduling and Platooning for Long-haul Freight Electric Vehicles.

item.title: New funded project on optimizing information value in stochastic transportation systems, sponsored by NSF.
Best Poster Award (2nd place) in INFORMS Annual Conference
item.description: INSPIRE LAB’s poster on Spatial Pricing of Ride-sourcing Services in a Congested Transportation Network received 2nd place in the poster competition in INFORMS Annual Conference 2021. Congratulations Fatima!

item.title: Data Mining of Plug-in Electric Vehicles Charging Behavior using Supply-Side Data
New funded project on Evaluating and Validating Technology Options for Estimating Transit Vehicle Occupancy in Real Time, sponsored by FDOT and collaborated with FSU and FIU
New funded project on deep reinforcement learning for speed control for network safety, sponsored by Safer-Sim Tier 1 UTC
